intro: Coussapoa villosa, commonly known as the hairy coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a rough texture. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
